Was this using Motif or GTK?  If using GTK you might have to specify on the 
command line:

-ws gtk

What was the exact command line you used to invoke eclipse?

It does not start on Mandrake 7.2
NoClassDefFoundException : org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget

Mickael and Matthias:

you are both experiencing the same problem.  The VM is failing to auto-detect 
the correct values for OS, WS (windowing system), or ARCH (machine architecture) 
on your particular setup.  Please do the following:

- copy the file <eclipse-install>/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime/.options to 
your <eclipse-install> directory.

- edit this file, and turn on the following debug flag:

org.eclipse.core.runtime/debug/context=true

- restart eclipse with the extra "-debug" command line parameter

Let us know what values are printed for OS, WS, and ARCH on your machine.  You 
can workaround these problems by explicitely passing the correct values on the 
command line to eclipse.

For Motif it should be something like this:

-ws motif -os linux -arch x86

Or for GTK:

-ws motif -os linux -arch x86

The eclipse executable should be auto-choosing the values for OS/ARCH/WS 
better now.

Closing.

Please re-open if you are having problems with the latest builds.
